Class Processor

java.lang.Object
microsim.simulation.component.SimulationComponent
microsim.simulation.component.Processor
public class Processor extends SimulationComponent
Implements a processor able to read/write on memory, load and execute instructions and govern I/O devices. The processor is built on a state machine that updates on SimulationComponent.step(). Available registers are:
  • GENERAL_REGISTERS general registers. This is fixed to 4:
    • %a.
    • %b.
    • %c.
    • %d.
  • Special registers:
    • %ip, the instruction pointer. Resets to RESET_INSTRUCTION_ADDRESS.
    • %sp, the stack pointer.
    • Flag register, accessible only to jump instructions. It contains bits:
      1. of, overflow flag.
      2. sf, sign flag.
      3. zf, zero flag.
      4. cf, carry flag.

    static enum 
    Processor.ProcessorState
    Enum representing all possible states of a processor in its instruction cycle.

  • Field Details

    • GENERAL_REGISTERS

      private static final int GENERAL_REGISTERS
      Number of general registers. Fixed to 4.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • RESET_INSTRUCTION_ADDRESS

      private static final char RESET_INSTRUCTION_ADDRESS
      The reset value of ip. This is set to EPROM_BEG from MemorySpace.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • opcodeStrings

      Map<Character, Processor.ProcessorState> opcodeStrings
      Maps opcodes (represented by Character) to execution states for instructions. Some instructions might be carried away in multiple states: in this case maps to the first execution state.

    • bus

      private final Bus bus
      Reference to the communication bus the component is mounted on.

    • generalRegisters

      private final char[] generalRegisters
      Array of general purpose registers, of size GENERAL_REGISTERS.

    • ip

      private char ip
      IP (Instruction Pointer) register.

    • sp

      private char sp
      SP (Stack Pointer) register.

    • of

      private boolean of
      OF (Overflow Flag)

    • sf

      private boolean sf
      SF (Sign Flag)

    • zf

      private boolean zf
      ZF (Zero Flag)

    • cf

      private boolean cf
      CF (Carry Flag)

    • sourceIndex

      private int sourceIndex
      Source register index for last decoded instruction. Register indices are as follows:
      1. %a.
      2. %b.
      3. %c.
      4. %d.
      5. %ip.
      6. %sp.

    • destIndex

      private int destIndex
      Destination register index for last decoded instruction. Register indices are same as destIndex.

    • temp

      private char temp
      Utility register used by memory access routines. Usage is as follows:
      1. Read routine: temp will contain the read data at the end of the operation.
      2. Write routine: temp must contain the data to be written before the beginning of the operation.

    • state

      private Processor.ProcessorState state
      Current state of processor. Initializes to fetch state.

    • returnState

      private Processor.ProcessorState returnState
      Auxiliary address used for minimal call/return functionality in processor microcode. Basically used as an MJR (Multiway Jump Register).

  • Constructor Details

    • Processor

      public Processor(Bus bus)
      Instantiates processor, taking a reference to the bus it's mounted on. Resets instruction pointer to RESET_INSTRUCTION_ADDRESS
      Parameters:
      bus - bus the component is mounted on

  • Method Details

    • getRegisters

      public char[] getRegisters()
      Register getter used by DebugShell objects displaying shells to show register information.
      Returns:
      processor registers in a Character array

    • getFlagRegister

      public boolean[] getFlagRegister()
      Flag register getter used by DebugShell objects displaying shells in the same context as getRegisters().
      Returns:
      flag register as a Boolean array

    • getState

      public Processor.ProcessorState getState()
      State getter used by DebugShell objects displaying shells to show state information.
      Returns:
      current processor state

    • step

      public void step()
      Steps by implementing a state machine transition based on state and returnState.
      Specified by:
      step in class SimulationComponent

    • doShift

      private char doShift(char dataS, char dataD, boolean direction)
      Performs shift operation.
      Parameters:
      dataS - source operand
      dataD - destination operand
      direction - direction of shift
      Returns:
      result of the shift

    • setLogicFlags

      private void setLogicFlags(char data)
      Sets SF ad ZD based on a result value.
      Parameters:
      data - result value

    • doAddition

      private char doAddition(char dataS, char dataD)
      Performs addition, setting flags.
      Parameters:
      dataS - source operand
      dataD - destination operand
      Returns:
      addition of source and destination

    • doSubtraction

      private char doSubtraction(char dataS, char dataD)
      Performs subtraction, setting flags.
      Parameters:
      dataS - source operand
      dataD - destination operand
      Returns:
      subtraction of source and destination

    • getRegisterAtIndex

      private char getRegisterAtIndex(int index)
      Gets register at specified index. Register indices are same as destIndex.
      Parameters:
      index - register index
      Returns:
      register value

    • setRegisterAtIndex

      private void setRegisterAtIndex(int index, char value)
      Sets register at specified index. Register indices are same as destIndex.
      Parameters:
      index - register index
      value - value to set register to

    • getExecutionState

      private Processor.ProcessorState getExecutionState(char opcode)
      Gets first execution state from given opcode using opcodeStrings map. Also sets sourceIndex and destIndex. Immediate operand resolution is assumed to be done by caller.
      Parameters:
      opcode - instruction opcode
      Returns:
      first execution state of instruction
